channel.title: Sum weird error?H.E.L.P
channel.description:
i was adding commands to a pi source, and some error came up because i didnt end the class with a brace, however thats fixed, after i compiled that error went away and some 2 new errors appeared.. :/ whats it mean??how do i fix it??
[IMG]http://i40.tinypic.com/fmjo7r.png[/img]

dw now i fixed all the errors without a guide like a boss (im new at this shit, dont get it twisted!) :L

item.dc:creator: @Null_Amount N_A
item.description:
@Null_Amount wrote:

[quote=“warxscape, post:8, topic:527352”][quote author=Null Amount link=topic=646099.msg4345040#msg4345040 date=1375747228]
Under any other normal player command. You also don’t need the conditional operators ( && playerRights >= 0).
[/quote]

even if i do add that, will it still work right?[/quote]Yes, but it’s unneeded so there’s no point keeping it there.

item.title: Sum weird error?H.E.L.P
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Make sure the command is not in the method:
public void ownerCommands

Read full topic

item.title: Sum weird error?H.E.L.P
item.dc:creator: @warxscape warxscape
item.description:
@warxscape wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:4, topic:527352”]c.playerXP is an array of ints, not a single int.
It needs to look like:
c.playerXP[ i] = c.getPA().getXPForLevel(99)+5;

Also, c.playerLevel is another array of ints, not a single int.
It needs to look like:
c.playerLevel[ i] = c.getPA().getLevelForXP(c.playerXP[ i]);

I suggest you read up on arrays.
Remove the spaces in: [ i][/quote]

thanks its fine now, and i searched it up before making this thread, i still dont understand it Facepalm!

ONE MORE THING: the ::master command is only working for the owner, how can i change this so everyone can use it? iv tried but failed just now…

if (playerCommand.startsWith(“master”) [color=red]&& c.playerRights >= 0)[/color] {
if (c.inWild())
return;
for(int i = 0; i < c.playerLevel.length; i++) {
c.playerXP[i] = c.getPA().getXPForLevel(99)+5;
c.playerLevel[i] = c.getPA().getLevelForXP(c.playerXP[i]);
c.getPA().refreshSkill(i);
}

the master command is yet only working for owners even when im trying to get it to work with player rights 0 (normal players)?

Read full topic

item.title: Sum weird error?H.E.L.P
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

c.playerXP is an array of ints, not a single int.
It needs to look like:
c.playerXP[ i] = c.getPA().getXPForLevel(99)+5;

Also, c.playerLevel is another array of ints, not a single int.
It needs to look like:
c.playerLevel[ i] = c.getPA().getLevelForXP(c.playerXP[ i]);

I suggest you read up on arrays.
Remove the spaces in: [ i]

item.title: Sum weird error?H.E.L.P
item.dc:creator: @warxscape warxscape
item.description:
@warxscape wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:2, topic:527352”]You’re trying to use an int when you need to use an int array.
Post the command you were editing[/quote]

if (playerCommand.startsWith(“master”)) {
if (c.inWild())
return;
for(int i = 0; i < c.playerLevel.length; i++) {
c.playerXP = c.getPA().getXPForLevel(99)+5;
c.playerLevel = c.getPA().getLevelForXP(c.playerXP);
c.getPA().refreshSkill(i);
}

so how do i fix this yo?
